Comment: Obviously not  However Trump/MAGA have dramatically raised their floor for voters. They became a cult that guarantees about 35% of the vote at ever major election, no matter what happens.   So democrats need to offer something that both excites and unites their base and pulls in enough people who swing vote or don’t vote regularly to beat that convincingly across the U.S., given how the college works and gerrymandering and so on.   You won’t do that by promising a return to how things were. That doesn’t excite anyone. Trump might well be so bad that (assuming fair elections) republicans get booted at the next time of asking, but it only sets the U.S. up for more Republican nonsense under a different leader in the near future if all the Dems want to deliver is more neoliberalism to slowly erode the middle and bottom and make the rich richer.

Comment: They have empathy. For people in their towns. For their communities. They can been the kindest people you ever meet. Who’d do anything for you. But they unfortunately have a hard time expanding that empathy to people they’ll never know or never meet. They’ve been told the scary “others” are coming to hurt them and their loved ones.   I’m not excusing it. I wish they had seen the light sooner, I wish we weren’t in this mess. But we have to understand that a good chunk of MAGA are just scared ignorant people who can come around. I just hope it will happen before we hit a point of no return.   And some of them can be really strong allies after they do. The family member of mine with the gay kid? She struggled at first, when her daughter came out, but now she’s a staunch supporter of the LGBT. She’s marched at pride, she argues with friends and family defending not just gay people, but trans and non binary people too. Because while some people have small empathy ranges, they can be expanded. The tribe can always get bigger
Author: Jdmaki1996

Comment: That’s a beautiful sentiment. I couldn’t agree more.   It’s hard to see that slim hope sometimes but I think that way of seeing it really is the key to doing something about it.   There is so much that is out of our control, but I think one thing we can and should be careful to control and monitor is how we let these realities impact our perception of these people. They may have a hard time expanding that empathy network on their own, but that’s why people like that need people like us who know how to do that and have the tools they lack. It’s just figuring out how to put those tools in their hands and make them actually want to use them that is the tricky part.
Author: nikolai_470000
